bug.author: gmanlan
bug.summary: mlpack_test.exe fails for some tests when running on Windows [3.1.1 release]
bug.description:
When building mlpack x64 from source, some tests fail when executed in a local Windows 10 system. These errors are diverse so if required, we can split them into different submissions. Build configuration:
mlpack 3.1.1 release or master branch Boost 1_65_1 (lib64-msvc-14.1) armadillo-9.300.2 OpenBLAS built using msvc - branch develop (April 2019) Visual Studio 15 2017 Win64 x64
Tests Errors:
unknown location(0): fatal error: in "ConvolutionalNetworkTest/VanillaNetworkTest": memory access violation Possible workaround: manually unzip the .arm dataset from mnist_first250_training_4s_and_9s.tar, then the test will pass
unknown location(0): fatal error: in "LoadSaveTest/CaseTest": class std::runtime_error: Parse error at line 13 token 0: "TA". Context: this is trying to parse the file casecheck.arff
parallel_sgd_test.cpp(100): fatal error: in "ParallelSGDTest/GeneralizedRosenbrockTest": absolute value of result{-nan(ind)} exceeds 1e-08
unknown location(0): fatal error: in "SdpPrimalDualTest/SmallLovaszThetaSdp": memory access violation occurred at address 0xfcfc4000, while attempting to write to an inaccessible (or protected) address. sdp_primal_dual_test.cpp(278): last checkpoint: "SmallLovaszThetaSdp" test entry
input stream error tests/serialization.hpp(235): fatal error: in "SerializationTest/LayerNormSerializationTest": critical check success == true has failed [false != true]
main_tests/decision_tree_test.cpp(103): fatal error: in "DecisionTreeMainTest/DecisionTreeCategoricalOutputDimensionTest": Cannot load train dataset braziltourism.arff!
I made an effort to go over open/closed issues and although I found some references, I couldn't find exact matches with these errors. If somebody has seen some of this issues before, please link them here. I have also checked one of the last AppVeyor builds and the tests seem to be passing fine, so I'm trying to understand if these failures are because:
Something is wrong with my local system? Boost version? (AppVeyor build script is using 1.60) Armadillo version? (AppVeyor build script is using 7.800.2) Visual Studio version? (for some reason AppVeyor build script is using Visual Studio 14 2015 Win64 for both the Jobs? If so, the VS2017 job is useless?)
Thanks

Sorry for the slow response---I know that [FATAL] Cannot open file 'nonexistentfile.arff'. is actually not a problem: the tests check that that file doesn't exist. But the RBM tests are a bit more problematic. However, I haven't seen this problem. On my Windows VM (which ended up being Windows 7 just because that happened to get set up ok...) I have the following versions of packages:
Armadillo 9.600-RC3 Boost 1.70.0 OpenBLAS 0.2.14.1 Visual Studio Community 2019, version 16.1.6
Of those I would expect the only two to make a difference would be Armadillo and possibly the Visual Studio version. The output I get for the RBM tests when I build the "RUN_TESTS" target is that they pass in ~15 seconds; no integer divide by zero issue or anything. If AppVeyor is not successfully building on Visual Studio 2017, we should definitely get that fixed for sure. I think I see the issue: the build_script section uses Visual Studio 14 2015 Win64 hardcoded, but it should actually be using the VSVER variable. I'm not sure exactly how that works in the AppVeyor config, but I'll see if I can find a minute to put into it in the near-term future.
I opened <denchmark-link:https://github.com/mlpack/mlpack/pull/1971>#1971</denchmark-link> to handle the Visual Studio version issues, so now AppVeyor will build mlpack on VS2015, VS2017, and VS2019.
